slides.title: Mandate Identification
slides.description: Institutional and commercial opportunities are screened for structural suitability, regulatory viability, and stakeholder alignment. Only mandates with clear ownership boundaries, feasible delivery pathways, and governance compatibility proceed to structuring.

slides.title: Supplier & Partner Structuring
slides.description: International suppliers and local operators are evaluated for capability, compliance fit, and enforceable participation. Assessment includes track record review, jurisdictional fit, delivery readiness, and commitment to reporting obligations.

slides.title: Contract Framework Design
slides.description: Multi-jurisdiction commercial frameworks are defined with clear scope, performance expectations, risk allocation, and governance boundaries. Contract architecture is designed to preserve execution accountability while enabling coordinated multi-party delivery.

slides.title: Independent Operator Engagement
slides.description: Where local execution is required, independent operating partners are engaged under mandate-specific authorization. PAG does not substitute execution accountability and does not act as operational proxy for regulated technical functions.

slides.title: Governance-Bounded Oversight
slides.description: PAG maintains oversight within its contractual perimeter while designated operators manage delivery responsibilities. Governance checkpoints track compliance posture, milestone adherence, risk escalation, and corrective action continuity.
